verses.verse: (A Psalm of David.) The Lord <WH3068> says <WH5002> to my Lord: <WH136> "Sit <WH3427> at My right <WH3225> hand, <WH3225> Until <WH5704> I make <WH7896> Thine enemies <WH340> a footstool <WH1916> <WH7272> for Thy feet. <WH7272>"
The Lord <WH3068> will stretch <WH7971> forth <WH7971> Thy strong <WH5797> scepter <WH4294> from Zion, <WH6726> [saying], "Rule <WH7287> in the midst <WH7130> of Thine enemies. <WH340>"

Thy people <WH5971> will volunteer <WH5071> freely <WH5071> in the day <WH3117> of Thy power; <WH2428> In holy <WH6944> array, <WH1926> from the womb <WH7358> of the dawn, <WH4891> Thy youth <WH3208> are to Thee [as] the dew. <WH2919>
The Lord <WH3068> has sworn <WH7650> and will not change <WH5162> His mind, <WH5162> "Thou art a priest <WH3548> forever <WH5769> According <WH5921> to the order <WH1700> of Melchizedek. <WH4442>"
The Lord <WH136> is at Thy right <WH3225> hand; <WH3225> He will shatter <WH4272> kings <WH4428> in the day <WH3117> of His wrath. <WH639>

He will judge <WH1777> among the nations, <WH1471> He will fill <WH4390> [them] with corpses, <WH1472> He will shatter <WH4272> the chief <WH7218> men <WH7218> over <WH5921> a broad <WH7227> country. <WH776>
He will drink <WH8354> from the brook <WH5158> by the wayside; <WH1870> Therefore <WH5921> <WH3651> He will lift <WH7311> up [His] head. <WH7218>
